pageContext.claim: “If you want to see a global depression, all you have to do is lift the oil price $50 a barrel, which could happen very quickly, once we lose that relationship [with Saudi Arabia].”
pageContext.analysis: In defending his soft stance toward Saudi Arabia, whose crown prince ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, Trump warned that losing the relationship could cause a spike in oil prices. But those prices depend on multiple market forces, not the decisions of one president or one country.
